1: <sup>1</sup> In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.
2: <sup>2</sup> Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
3: <sup>3</sup> What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?
4: <sup>4</sup> Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.
5: <sup>5</sup> Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
6: <sup>6</sup> My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
7: <sup>7</sup> I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.
